key_points: The Department of Defense released the names of the 13 US service members killed in an attack at Kabul's airport.

Among the deceased were Army Staff Sgt. Ryan Knauss, US Marine Rylee McCollum, Cpl. Daegan Page, US Navy corpsman Maxton Soviak, Marine Corps Cpl. Hunter Lopez, Marine Corps Lance Cpl. Jared M. Schmitz, and Marine Corps Sgt. Nicole L. Gee.
Ryan Knauss was honored for his heroism by US Rep. Tim Burchett, and he was the only Army member killed in the attack.
Rylee McCollum, at 20 years old, was on his first deployment and expected to become a father in three weeks.
Daegan Page's family remembered him for his compassionate nature and plans for the future beyond his military service.
Maxton Soviak was celebrated for his pride in serving as a Navy corpsman attached to the Marines.
Hunter Lopez planned to follow in his parents' footsteps and join law enforcement after military service.
Jared M. Schmitz was remembered by his father for his dedication to the Marine Corps and special bond with his sister.
Nicole L. Gee was featured on the Department of Defense's social media for her love of her job, just days before the attack.
GoFundMe pages and public tributes have been set up for the families of the deceased service members.
